urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: Heavy rainfall is expected in the region over the coming days - this may bring a risk of flooding. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels. Find out if you are at risk of flooding here: https://t.co/NnjRE8XkT0 #floodaware

Do you know what to do in a flood?
The @EnvAgency has produced some useful info on what to do if one happens near you.

Find it here and discover if you're in a flood risk area‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/mMo8B06GkV https://t.co/d2ETN3icpj
Don‚Äôt swim in the Thames in West London! Not even dip a toe. People sail and paddle board in it too. But it might be full of shit. https://t.co/HlLlWxUdiO

tweets.text: @BOYcooke @metoffice @EnvAgencyYNE Hi David, All roads and pavements are on a schedule and will be cleared ASAP, Thanks Danielle

UK aluminium packaging recycling rates have officially exceeded their 2020 target with three months of the year still remaining. https://t.co/8Qh3tPHXDa @AluproUK @EnvAgency #aluminium #packaging #recycling #metalrecyclesforever https://t.co/liSDVWQcAo
@Calderdale @metoffice @EnvAgencyYNE Any chance of clearing the leaves on Burnley Road in todmorden by the park? The gullys are awash with them. I've cleared a stretch by my house.

For #LondonRiversWeek2020, we have a brand new #TalkoftheThames podcast!
 
This special edition discusses the key messages of London Rivers Week with a panel of speakers from across the Thames Estuary including from @Thames21 @EnvAgency @SE_Rivers_Trust! 
https://t.co/2Cq93B9k8s https://t.co/UCnQE2XxfA

The forecast of rain today brings the risk of #flooding for the #NorthWest. 

Are you prepared?

Step 1. Check your flood risk https://t.co/e2TzH4KlsK (it takes less than a minute to check)

Step 2. Sign up for free flood warnings

Step 3. Keep up to date https://t.co/QG5hHwvkvB

Great to show @jogideon around the #StaffsSUNRISE Victoria Ground project this morning with our partners @EnvAgencyMids. We talked about the need for a #GreenRecovery and how restoring our urban green spaces is good for the economy, improves air quality and health and wellbeing. https://t.co/Ema144Pojj

Anyone who knows @WoodlandTrust #SmihtillsEstate knows it‚Äôs wet! We‚Äôre carrying out #NaturalFloodManagement works to hold back the flows of water to help water subside better down stream @livuni @EnvAgencyNW @merseyforest https://t.co/LwQgBNOTaW

This October half term do your bit to keep our environment clean.

Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/j0Tnipo1ro
The fish pass at Lower Mill on the Letcombe Brook is now completed and flowing well! Nice working with you @CainBio and thanks for the funding @EnvAgency https://t.co/DAmorl9lKq
@LetcombeBP @CainBio @EnvAgency So has the mill been blocking fish ever since it was built?

If you don‚Äôt pick up after your dog, who will? 

Don‚Äôt make the mistake of thinking someone else will clean up your dog's poo after you. 

Always #BagItBinIt to make sure we keep our water safe!

#BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/w11KmcBBJ8

Yellow warnings of rain are in force from 12pm today until 9pm on Saturday.

Vulnerable assets are being checked and our Community Protection team is ready to respond if needed.

Please take care, stay safe and follow @metoffice for updates. @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/3tgWOHc2C0

Please share! 
We're proud to be a part of the #YouthClimateSummit2020, a week of virtual climate action for schools. 
Our session 'Our Peatland Protectors features #JuniorRangers and #SphagnumMoss 
Book now - see you there! https://t.co/2KcmOq1PBC
#SphagnumMonday @LIFEprogramme https://t.co/JBWq0snijD

urls.title: The Flood Hub
urls.description: Posted: 07/06/21 From 14th ‚Äì 18th May we are hosting a Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS) Focus Week, looking at what SuDS are, how they reduce flood risk, and the many benefits they provide. There will be examples of the types of SuDS you can install in your home and garden, and case studies of larger SuDS projects across the North West. Posted: 24/05/21 On 19 May 2021 four new flood warning services were launched in Coniston (Cumbria) Caton (Lancashire), and Worthington and Atherton (Greater Manchester)

tweets.text: After a few days off I am back in and @EnvAgencyNW are preparing for rain over the next few days - you can find out how you can #BePrepared @TheFloodHub https://t.co/vm9R4Zna4s https://t.co/c3YTxzp34N

@mycountycouncil @EnvAgency @Michael_Ellis1 @andrealeadsom @ALewerMBE  - Perhaps you all should know what‚Äôs happening closer to home too. Because @NorthamptonBC @VeoliaUK  go against their word I‚Äôm left taking our excess household waste to the tip.

‚ö†Ô∏è We use a network of boreholes across Dorset and Wiltshire to monitor groundwater levels. When the thresholds are met, we issue Groundwater Flood Alerts and warnings. Go to https://t.co/AvKymXWwCL to monitor your local borehole #Groundwater ‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/S8JW8nc8sF

21 containers of illegally exported waste sent to Sri Lanka have successfully returned to England.

We will investigate who exported this #WasteCrime. 

Those responsible could face 2 years in prison, and an unlimited fine.

Read more here: https://t.co/ti1Wt6XYYP https://t.co/a347mSYEpi

The Environment Agency continues to respond to reports of illegal waste sites around the North West. 

Do you suspect illegal waste activities? 

Report it to the Environment Agency 24/7 on 0800 80 70 60, or call @CrimestoppersUK anonymously on 0800 555 111.

#wastecrime

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE

tweets.text: If we are going to have another talking shop on #wastecrime then why are @EnvAgency and those being affected not included. When will we do something rather than sitting in an echo chamber? https://t.co/7GmjI320vG

* carrying on with our @swardley mapping work with @BeDifrent to map out all the operational, digital, data and technology components we need so we can decide how to build / buy / rent / otherwise make sure we have them and that they work properly for our users
@MRWmagazine EA needs to start prosecuting under Duty of Care then. That would stop much of this.

We have heard this before. How long does it take to stop producers sending waste to the developing world? @EnvAgency have been making statements like this for more than 10 years with little effect. https://t.co/f7tyj2yJZD

This story nearly brought me to tears. In 2000 Robert noticed that sewage was frequently being dumped on Seaburn beach by his house. He & friends spent 20 years trying to stop it. He's now in his late 70s and he's the only one left alive...1/2
https://t.co/En2Fxtyp3b

Day 77

2020 has more to give.

The public finding out about toxic #PFOS and #PFAS chemicals in UK waters. 

https://t.co/CHfxhAYiGt

urls.title: Rules for farmers and land managers to prevent water pollution
urls.description: What you must do to manage manure, fertiliser and soil to prevent runoff, erosion and leaching.

tweets.text:
Farmers we need your help to protect our watercourses‚ö†Ô∏è

Do not add fertilizer if there is no soil or crop need.  

Talk to us or your agronomist for advice. 

There is also guidance here: https://t.co/5yaPLIKCpi #Farmers #water https://t.co/4aRFFulBld
Looking forward to the Diglis #FishPass being completed to help the salmon on their way! #FishMigration @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/LVlzeXENcf

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.
